summary:
Cossacks are an East Slavic people with a rich history in Ukraine and Russia. They were known for their military skills, serving as irregular troops for various rulers. The Zaporozhian Cossacks were infantry, while the Don Cossacks were cavalry. Living in semi-nomadic communities called hosts, they had a unique culture and self-governance.

After facing disruptions during the Russian Revolution and World War II, Cossacks experienced a revival in the late 20th century. Many now live across the world, with Cossack organizations in several countries, preserving their cultural identity and traditions.
title: Cossacks
